sentences.sContent: I can’t remember her exact words.
I remember it well ; I’d never seen my mother so angry.
sentences.sCn: 这件事我记得很清楚；我从未见过母亲这么生气。

sentences.sContent: She clearly remembers the excitement as they boarded the train.
sentences.sCn: 她清楚地记得他们登上火车时的激动心情。

sentences.sContent: I vaguely remember reading something about it in the paper.
sentences.sCn: 我隐约记得在报纸上看到过有关情况。

sentences.sContent: They had three children, if I remember rightly .
sentences.sCn: 如果我没记错，他们有三个孩子。

sentences.sContent: You left your keys on the table, remember?
sentences.sCn: 你把钥匙放在桌子上了，想起来了吗？

sentences.sContent: I hope he remembers the wine.
...I can definitely remember what I learned on certain days at school...
...I remember my aunt Mary used to say if you swallow a cherrystone...
...Don’t you remember all those things we used to believe when we were little...
...their memories are highly self-centred: although they can remember “autobiographical” life events in extraordinary detail...
...This type of memory where you are trying to remember new...
...Veiseh began to remember the details of his everyday experiences after he met his first young love...
...The majority of previous research has focused on how we learn and remember new information...
...A very small number of people are able to remember almost every detail of their life...
...all the time! I don't really remember working – of course...
...I remember sitting on a bench with my aunt at a yoga studio...

phrases.pCn: 约束自己；检点；(犯过失后)反省；仔细想一想；恢复镇定
代某人向某人致意(或问好)
记得要做某事；记得去做某事

words.tran: 回想，回忆；纪念品；记忆力

trans.tranOther: to have a picture or idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past
